title: Girlan 2014 Indra Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Tomato leaf, cut grass and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose on this racy, linear wine. The vibrant, savory palate doles out juicy yellow grapefruit, yellow peach and a mineral note while lively acidity leaves a crisp, clean finish.

title: Gradis'ciutta 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: A few swirls of the glass release subtle, refined aromas of yellow stone fruit and hazelnut. The lively palate offers yellow apple, sage, mineral and bitter almond alongside bright acidity.

title: Zorzon 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Intense aromas that recall tomato vine, hay, stone fruit and dill lead the nose. The vibrant palate shows honeydew melon, grapefruit and mineral alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Château Potensac 2015 La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is light with great freshness. It has a fine burst of black currant flavors that translate into crisp acidity. The tannins are just there.
designation: La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample

title: Château Tour de Pez 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh and crisp, with red berry fruits and firm levels of tannin. It has a smoky edge that is attractive, although the acidity will remain marked.

title: Conde de Hervías & Mencos 2011 Mencos Viura (Rioja)
description: Butterscotch and apple aromas are focused but limited. The palate on this barrel-driven Viura is fresh and direct, even though the style involves oxidation. Flavors of raw wood and apricot finish lively. Drink through 2020.

title: Del Rio 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)
description: This opens with a creamy, fresh texture underscored with light minerality. Lime and pineapple sparkle among a wealth of citrus highlights. This almost screams out for Thai food.

title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2009 Furstentum Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: The sweet peach fruit on nose and palate almost borders on over-ripeness, so fleshy, so decadent is its richness. It is on the palate that orange zest provides some offset and more perfume. Decadent in its truest sense.

title: A to Z 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: A to Z is giving other volume Pinot Gris producers a run for top gun with this superb value. Pear, quince and satsuma-orange flavors come together in a sappy, luscious wine that carries on delightfully through a rich, clean finish.

title: Abacela 2013 Fiesta Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Abacela makes up to four different Tempranillos in a given vintage, this being the entry-level bottle. And a fine introduction it is, with vivid red and black berries, a dusting of sweet spices, a gentle whiff of tanned leather, chalk and ample tannins. Aged in both French and American oak, 15% new, it is drinking quite nicely already.

title: Abacela NV Vintner's Blend #15 Red (Umpqua Valley)
description: This 15th edition of this nonvintage blend, sourced entirely from estate grapes (principally Tempranillo), is a sure-fire palate pleaser. Fresh and youthful, it's bursting with plush boysenberries, loganberries and blackberries, annotated with a streak of coffee and cacao.

title: Adega Mãe 2012 Petit Verdot (Lisboa)
description: Petit Verdot is known for its color, and this wine is dark purple, almost black. The tannins are also pretty prominent, although they are balanced by a freshness from black currant fruits and a fine, mineral structure. There is a touch of pepper and spice at the end. Drink from 2018.

title: Andriano 2014 Andrius Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This vibrant white offers aromas suggesting elderflower, chopped herb, citrus and a whiff of tomato leaf. On the tangy palate, zesty acidity underscores grapefruit, apricot and nectarine zest while a flinty note seals the crisp finish.

title: Castello di Spessa 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: Delicate aromas of both toasted nuts and pear waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, a mineral vein enhances rennet apple, citrus zest and bitter almond while zesty acidity leaves a tangy finish.

title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)
description: This ripe, wood-aged wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley. It has a cool, mineral character that suits it well. Fresh with acidity and tight with its chalky texture, it's a delicious wine to drink now, fruity, tangy and complex.

title: Château du Taillan 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Soft and juicy, this wine is open and will develop fast. It has an attractive blackberry flavor and a lining of tannins to give it shape. The aftertaste is back to the fruitiness.

title: Big Smooth 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Fruity, ripe and yummy, this wine offers aromas that are spicy and slightly oaky from 14 months in mostly American barrels. The flavors are packed with ripe cherry and blackberry. Despite very full body in terms of alcohol, the texture is smooth, tannins are light and the finish lingers.

title: Boekenhoutskloof 2014 The Wolftrap Viognier-Chenin Blanc-Grenache Blanc White (Western Cape)
description: A blend of 48% Viognier, 41% Chenin Blanc and 11% Grenache Blanc, this medium-weight wine offers ripe fruit aromas and flavors of Anjou pear, peach and orange rind that are complemented by notes of fennel, mentholated fynbos and ginger. Medium acidity cuts through the rich mouthfeel, with a lasting kiss of toasted spice on the close. Drink now.

title: Bonny Doon 2014 Clos de Gilroy Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This Randall Grahm wine, which also includes 9% Mourvèdre and 2% Syrah, hits the nose with tight raspberry juice, hibiscus, cola and iron aromas, proving tight and mineral-driven. Pencil lead leads the lighter palate, which also shows brisk pomegranate, black and white pepper and a menthol-like Sichuan-peppercorn sensation on the finish. It's a tremendous wine for the price.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2014 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle touches of mineral oil lend richness and depth to spry white floral, lemon and lime notes in this light-footed dry Riesling. Bursts of white grapefruit flavor dominate the midpalate, marking a brisk, clean finish. Drink now through 2017.

title: Dr. Nägler 2014 Rüdesheim Bischofsberg Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Chalk and slate meld into blossomy floral tones in this fragrant off-dry Riesling. Zesty and spry, the palate is marked by flavors of freshly pressed apple, pear and lemon. Drink now through 2020.

title: Heinz Eifel 2014 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Layers of smoke, slate, saffron and pollen lend earthy, mineral complexities to bright honey and tangerine flavors in this off-dry kabinett. It's brisk and refreshingly juicy yet intriguingly nuanced. Drink now through 2018.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara)
description: Tempting spicy aromas like cedar and clove lead to rich but bright fruit flavors shaded by smoke and black pepper. This wine has commendable complexity without going over the top, and a nice, firm texture of fine tannins and good acidity for balance.

title: Painted Wolf 2013 The Den Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: Attractive herbal aromas of freshly dried grass, orange blossom and lime leaf seamlessly complement the fruity core of clean citrus, Anjou pear and white melon. Touches of clove and toast unfold on the palate, while mouthwatering acidity keeps the mouthfeel fresh and bright. Accents of melon rind and beeswax kiss the finish. Drink now.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: The red wine is rich, dense and packed with fruit and tannins. It comes from the heart of the Lisboa region, giving plenty of structure from the cool-climate vineyards. There are fine red-fruit flavors shot through by juicy acidity. The wine has a drier, still developing tannic aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Nals Margreid 2014 Gennen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This linear white opens with aromas suggesting gooseberry elderflower, Alpine herb and citrus. The tangy palate offers grapefruit, honeydew melon and white stone fruit while a mineral note adds depth.

title: Girlan 2014 Plattenriegl Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Pretty aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone waft out of the glass. On the crisp palate, bright acidity balances green apple, Williams pear and a hint of citrus while a mineral note closes the finish.

title: Fairsing 2013 Sullivan Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The Sullivan designate complements the Dardis, with a different mix of clones. Here it's Pommard and Dijon 777, and the wine is robust and textural. Aging in 28% new French oak brings up highlights of baking spices around fruit that runs from rhubarb to strawberry to cherry pie. It's balanced and light, and should drink well through 2022.

title: Maley Brothers Vineyards 2013 Lodi Native Wegat Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: Fruity in flavor, fresh and elegant in texture, this wine tastes pure and unmanipulated. The berry and candied-cherry flavors are delicious, and the mouthfeel is smooth. It finishes with a touch of black pepper.

title: Le Nardian 2015 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Sweet citrus flavors and spice are lifted by vibrant acidity. It is a ripe wine, reflecting the vintage, with its lively acidity and tight, mineral finish.
